userreviews.userReview: A really nice and well designed book to understand the colours and how to use them, it identifies and explains Colour palette and charts, opposite colours, how to use different colours together as well as how to use same colour in different tones. It starts the introduction from how to set your studio / organise your materials and covers what you will need then goes into well explained colouring methods and information on colours. There is lots of terminology and methods to learn. I would recommend this book to people who want a kick start to oil / acrylic painting.Also, It would have been nice to see some watercolour advice.

This helpful Beginning Colour Mixing book is a wonderful addition to any artist starting out. It explains everything so well, from the colour palette to putting the colours onto a canvas in the right order.The first chapter "Getting Started" explains how to set up your work space, the painting tools & materials required and some basic painting techniques.The Colour Theory chapter covers helps the reader understand the colour wheel and colour schemes.  Painting with Colour further expands on the previous chapter, explaining each colour in turn. Plus using one colour on a card it shows how other colours work together, a great way to understand the colour palette even more.The last chapter shows 4 different painted images that have been broken down into steps to achieve the finished painting.Throughout the book there are useful tips and lots of colour pictures and colour schemes to help you achieve painting something yourself.

Portfolio: Beginning Color Mixing by author Kimberly Adams is a very informative help for beginners and intermediate painters. This volume is in reference to oils or acrylics in color mixing and understanding the placement of colors in different types of paintings. In this book, the theory of color mixing for paint is easy to understand for beginners and the illustrations are very detailed. I found the instructions very useful even in the placement of colorful fabrics for my art quilts. The paintings which are used for examples are impressive!Thank you to NetGalley and the Publisher for the opportunity to read and review this very helpful book.

This is a colorful book of tips and techniques for mixing and using colors. From setting up your workspace, understanding color, to painting with color, this book has it all, along with the plethora of colorful pictures to use as visual aids. I love color and can appreciate the knowledge needed to achieve the colors I imagine for my paintings, whether on cakes, paper, tile or canvas.With a lot of practice, you will be able to dream and translate your colors to canvas too. I received this book through NetGalley for my honest opinion.

This is a fabulous book for anyone who is starting out painting (and probably more experienced painters would also learn something ). I splash colour about on a canvas, sometimes I get lucky and it looks good, but most times it is an awful mess and I need to paint over it. This book is really easy to read and understand, all the sections from "getting started"," colour theory", "painting with colour" to "painting from life" have been well explained, illustrated and examples of are shown. I particularly love the "painting with colour" section as it is extremely informative and illustrates what different colour placement make. I really recommend this book both for its information and easy reading style used

I really enjoy Beginning of Color Mixing. I am teaching my eight-year-old son about color theory and mixing colors. This book is a wonderful guide! It starts with the basics like understanding the color wheel and scaffolds up, so it is appropriate for all “levels” of artists. It is also appropriate for all ages. The techniques author Kimberly Adams shares are useful, yielding magnificent results. I highly recommend this book!

I received a copy of Portfolio: Beginning of Color Mixing in exchange for a fair and honest review.	Beginning of Color Mixing has got to be one of the most vibrant and beautiful art guides I’ve read in quite some time, which I feel like is saying something. The artist, Kimberly Adams, certainly has full right to be teaching others about color theory and mixing colors, based on the artwork shown in this book. Half the time I found myself distracted by her beautiful work, only to remember I was supposed to be reading the book…	This guide is wonderfully comprehensive, from cover the basics (like setting up a workspace and how to understand a color wheel), to color placement and individual tips on the use of many different colors. I want to say there are about three to four pages for the most common colors used, and the artwork that goes along with each guide is both beautiful and supportive. 	Also included are some tips and tricks for painting from life, with some really fantastic step by step images showing the progression of a few different pieces of her work. I particularly loved these images – seeing how Kimberly Adams layered the paintings was both fascinating and informative. 	I really enjoyed reading this guide by Kimberly Adams, and I would love to see more of her work. I’ll be honest and say that I hadn’t heard of her before this, but can now safely say she’s gained a new fan.For more reviews, check out Quirky Cat's Fat Stacks

"Beginning Color Mixing" is an art techniques book on how to pick what colors to use to create vivid, colorful artwork. The author creates colorful, finger-painted, Impressionistic landscapes. Her technique is to use vivid colors straight from the tube (mainly oil, but also acrylic or watercolor) and place dabs of color next to each other to create eye-catching paintings. (This book won't be of much help if you're looking for instruction on mixing your own colors on a palette; it's about placing color on the canvas.)The author briefly covered tools, materials, etc., and then discussed the basics of colors and color theory. Then she talked about the main colors--reds, pinks, oranges, yellows, greens, blues, purples, neutrals, black and white--as well as the specific paint colors that she uses to create a range of red (or other) colors in her paintings. She also gave tips about specific paint colors that look good together and how to use color to draw the eye or unify the painting.She was very easy to understand and her demonstrations were clear and well-illustrated. She provided 4 step-by-step landscape demonstrations (lighthouse and ocean, clouds and a field, fall trees, and more trees) in her Impressionistic style. Overall, I'd recommend this book to any painter who is drawn to her vivid, colorful paintings--like the one on the cover.I received a free ebook review copy from the publisher through NetGalley

I received a DIGITAL Advance Reader Copy of this book from #NetGalley in exchange for an honest review. From the publisher --- Learn the core concepts and techniques for mixing any color your palette needs with Beginning Color Mixing! Perfect for aspiring, beginning, and intermediate artists, the concept- and technique-driven approach makes this challenging subject approachable for artists of any skill level.Loaded with techniques on how to use and create color for vivid artwork, Beginning Color Mixing explains every key aspect of color mixing. You’ll see basic color theory, hue and saturation, value, temperature, and color relationships and learn to wield color to create mood and atmosphere.Each key concept is clearly explained, allowing you to master the core techniques and put them into practice immediately whether you’re working in oil, acrylic, or watercolor. Featuring plenty of step-by-step exercises and expert instruction, this is a resource no painter’s library should be without.Great little book of instructions on how to get your colours POPPING off your canvasses. I could spend all day mixing paint as it is so relaxing and this book is an excellent guide for me to waste more time on doing so. 😊 Great for artists of all levels.
I look forward to the opportunity to review,"Portfolio: Beginning Color Mixing: Tips and techniques for mixing vibrant colors and cohesive palettes"by Kimberly Adams.

Thanks to Netgalley, the publisher. and the author for allowing me to read and review a digital copy of this book. A lot of good information. Focus on oil/acrylic and a lot of terms and methodology. But an interesting read to help understand color mixing and painting.
A lot of good information. Focus on oil/acrylic and a lot of terms and methodology. But an interesting read to help understand color mixing and painting.
A beautiful book that gives some great tips on how to mix colour, paint and organise your work space. Some great tips that are really useful.
Kimberly shares her professionals techniques and tips by using step by step illustrated instructions. This book should be in any arts library. Wonderful!

I found Portfolio: Beginning Color Mixing: Tips and techniques for mixing vibrant colors and cohesive palettesby Kimberly Adams. A beautifully written book. There's so much information throughout this book about core concepts and mixing techniques of mixing colours and for them to become other colours. It explains in great detail how to create your work with colours and how to apply these. I loved the way Kimberly explained the basic theory of the colours and how they work within the book and then adding these to your own picture. This is a must for any beginner who wants to learn how to mix paints etc and them add them to your picture etc. I received a DIGITAL Advance Reader Copy of this book from NetGalley in exchange for an honest review. This book is VERY GOOD. Especially as I forgot some of these techniques and they will be used again whilst I create my work in my craft room x

This book introduces colour mixing, colour combination and, of course, gives an introduction in colour theory. I especially liked the information on which colours work well together and how to mix the colours od one family to make them appear warmer or colder. Futher, the introduction to painting colourful clouds was very interesting.

description: Learn the core concepts and techniques for mixing any color your palette needs with Beginning Color Mixing! Perfect for aspiring, beginning, and intermediate artists, the concept- and technique-driven approach makes this challenging subject approachable for artists of any skill level. Loaded with techniques on how to use and create color for vivid artwork, Beginning Color Mixing explains every key aspect of color mixing. You’ll see basic color theory, hue and saturation, value, temperature, and color relationships and learn to wield color to create mood and atmosphere. Each key concept is clearly explained, allowing you to master the core techniques and put them into practice immediately whether you’re working in oil, acrylic, or watercolor. Featuring plenty of step-by-step exercises and expert instruction,this is a resource no painter’s library should be without.
title: Portfolio: Beginning Color Mixing: Tips and techniques for mixing vibrant colors and cohesive palettes
